response.raw:
## Status
Active for V1.3 visual polish (pixel art). Providing a concrete proposal list based on v1.2.9 baseline screenshots.

## Deliverables
- Pixel art improvement proposal list (terrain, paths, buildings, units, VFX) with low-risk, deterministic-friendly changes.
- Before/after comparison plan (v1.2.9 baseline → v1.3_after captures).

## Proposal list (concrete, scoped)
1) Terrain readability pass (P0)
- Reduce grass speckle density; add subtle macro clumps and rare ground props (deterministic by tile coord).
- Increase contrast between grass and path tiles (slightly darker path edges + lighter path interior).
- Add 3–5 deterministic tree variants (small canopy shifts + tiny shadow) for less repetition.

2) Path definition pass (P0)
- Add 1px edge banding on paths to improve silhouette at Z2.
- Add 2–3 path variants for straight segments and corners (still neighbor-agnostic to keep perf simple).

3) Building silhouette + materials (P1)
- Increase roof silhouette variety across core tier-1 buildings (castle/inn/market/blacksmith/guardhouse/house/farm/food_stand).
- Add minimal material separation: stone base vs wood walls vs roof color, using 1–2 extra accent pixels per sprite.
- Keep footprint and anchor identical to avoid engine changes.

4) Unit readability (P1)
- Improve hero/peasant/guard outlines and add tiny team-color accents (1–2 pixels) for quick glance reads.
- Ensure enemy silhouettes are distinct at 32x32: add small weapon/ear/limb cues for goblin/wolf/skeleton/spider/bandit.

5) Fog-of-war edge + reveal clarity (P2)
- Add subtle halo/edge brightening on fog boundary (1px band) to make explored vs unexplored more readable.
- Keep fog fully non-authoritative (pure render), deterministic (seeded by tile coord).

6) Micro-VFX polish (P2)
- Slightly longer projectile lifetime (if needed) and add 1–2 pixel trail; keep deterministic and cached.
- Add tiny dust puffs for footsteps (optional, capped rate) to improve life/feel.

## Before/after comparison plan
- Capture after shots into: docs/screenshots/v1.3_after/
- Use same scenarios/zoom as baseline (mirror v1.2.9 shots) for direct comparison.

## Acceptance criteria
- Terrain and paths read more clearly at Z2 without increasing visual noise.
- Tier-1 buildings are distinguishable by silhouette/material at a glance.
- Units (peasants/guards/heroes/enemies) are readable in motion without changing gameplay balance.

## Risks
- Over-detailing increases noise; must keep low-frequency texture and readable silhouettes.
- Procedural changes must remain deterministic and cached (no per-frame allocations).

## Dependencies
- None blocking. UI polish handled by Agent 08 in parallel.

## Recommended next actions
- Start with terrain + paths (highest ROI, low risk) using procedural sprite tweaks.
- Then update tier-1 building sprites in-place (no footprint change).
- Finish with unit readability pass and optional fog edge polish.
